page.title: 10At School in the 1980's
page.content: {George Fentham Endowed Primary} {School}is for children from the age of 4 to 11. We start each morning at 8.55 a.m. and finish at 3.45 p.m. During that time we do Mathematics, English, General Studies and other work. Our school is small but is equipped with a video, television, computer, disc drives, printer, projector, camera and tape recorders. A warbler, which is very loud, signals the end of lesson times. Outside, next to the netball court, there are garden plots, climbing frames and a pond. We have several school pets, including a gerbil, guinea-pigs and stick insects. We can have school dinners or bring sandwiches. There are 6{classrooms,}a hall, kitchen, staffroom, medical room, library and 2 offices. There are 6{teachers,}a headteacher and a secretary. We really do quite well.
